page.title: 01Aberford-General Information
page.content: Aberford is a small rural village.The population is 1,300.Aberford used to be on the path of the Great North Road but now the A1 bypasses it.It is 10 miles east of Leeds.At the south of the village are mainly old houses and cottages made of stone.At the north of the village are mainly new houses. Aberford is a one street village.The bus service goes to Leeds and Castleford but people mostly travel by car.Aberford has little industry.There are 7 farms in and around the village. There are 6 shops,a hairdressers and 3 inns.There are 2 churches and a chapel.There is also a village hall. There is a school which is over 250 years old.It is now a Church of England school which caters for pupils of 5-11 years,but it was a National School in the 19th. century.
